title: iTerm2: irssi in tmux remote over mosh leaves artifacts
body: (FPD) I'm running irssi inside tmux on a remote server which I connect to via mosh, but it keeps leaving artifacts around or, in other words - not update the whole buffer.

(FPD) The most noticable and ever repeating mishappen is, the whole buffer, containing irssi, resonates static, and only the single last line keeps updating as new messages are posted to the current channel.

Here is a typescript of a terminal session where this happens: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/168187/irssiresonatesstatic

And here is screenshot of a irssi session: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/168187/first.png
And here it is where the last line has updated, but the rest of the buffer has not: https://dl.dropbox.com/u/168187/second.png
Does this happen with irssi directly inside mosh (no tmux)?
(TP) And could you please upgrade mosh-server and mosh-client to 1.2.3 and see if you still have the problem?
The trace output indicates that mosh-server is version 1.1.3 or earlier.
(TP) Nope, it works perfectly if not using tmux.
Thats good to know.
Also, my package manager says I have 1.2.3 installed.
(FP) scootserv's `mosh-server` appears to be 1.1.3 or earlier, based on the "mosh-server: invalid option -- 'l'" in the typescript.
If you run `mosh-server` on scootserv, what version number does it print out?
Damn, I didn't think about checking what was installed on my server.
That is indeed 1.1.3.
(FP) seems thats the latest available in ubuntu's upstream repository.
Ubuntu doesn't update its software after the release, but 1.2.3 is available in the PPA (directions are on http://mosh.mit.edu).

(`sudo add-apt-repository ppa:keithw/mosh; sudo apt-get update; sudo apt-get install mosh`)

1.2.2 is also available in the Ubuntu "backports" repository for Ubuntu 12.04 LTS.
(TP) If you still see the problem with 1.2.3, could you please provide a typescript recorded (1) inside the tmux (and outside irssi) (2) inside mosh (and outside tmux) and (3) outside mosh?
(TP) With those three, we should be able to nail down whose bug this is and figure out a fix for you.
I'd like to pipe in to say that I'm experiencing the same issue with irssi running in Ubuntu's byobu.
I'm running mosh 1.2.3 on both sides of the connection.
(FP) Let me know what additional info you need to debug this, and I'll be happy to help.
Hello @HorizonXP -- the same info as we asked for in https://github.com/keithw/mosh/issues/341#issuecomment-9756349 would be much appreciated.
(TP) Except I am going to just guess that you are running gnome-terminal as your outer terminal, in which case you are probably seeing a bug in VTE (the outer terminal emulator).
Are you able to replicate the problem using xterm?
Hey @keithw, I'm able to replicate the same problem using xterm.
(FP) Also, I'm actually using xfce4-terminal 0.4.8, not gnome-terminal, though they're likely fairly similar.
(FP) I'm unclear about which typescripts you need.
(FP) 1) A typescript inside tmux, outside of irssi, of just a shell session?
Connecting via ssh or mosh?
2) Inside mosh, outside tmux, and inside of irssi?
3) Outside mosh, outside tmux, and inside irsssi?
(FP) Yes, we want to see the input to tmux, the output of tmux, and the output of mosh.
(Simultaneously.)
Sorry for not replying to this.
I'm sorry, I'm a bit noob-ish.
(FP) I'm not sure what exactly you need me to do.
Am I running the 'script' command?
How exactyl?
Locally or remotely?
(FP) Ok, i think I have what you need.
Let me know if they help.

http://dl.dropbox.com/u/50184433/typescript_ssh_no_tmux
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/50184433/typescript_ssh_yes_tmux
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/50184433/typescript_mosh_no_tmux
http://dl.dropbox.com/u/50184433/typescript_mosh_yes_tmux
For what it's worth, I had this problem in weechat inside tmux without mosh.
What is $TERM inside of tmux?
If it is not a screen variant, you may have issues with redraw in ncurses inside tmux.
(TP) If you need $TERM other than a screen variant inside of tmux, try starting irssi with `TERM=screen-256color irssi`.
(FN) I use the following function in my zshrc file for calling weechat appropriately.

(TP) ```shell
function irc () {
	if [[ $TMUX = '' ]]; then
		weechat-curses
	else
		TERM=screen-256color weechat-curses
	fi
}
```

Then I just call `irc` from the shell to start weechat.
(TP) @eternalsword that completely solved my issue.
Thank you so much for chiming in and pasting that little script.

(TP) @eternalsword @HorizonXP instead of setting `TERM` when starting irssi or WeeChat, (YOU COULD) add this snippet to your `~/.tmux.conf`:

```
set -g default-terminal "screen-256color"
```

For screen, you can add this to your `~/.screenrc`:

```
term screen-256color
```

You'll also need to make sure your local `TERM` supports 256 colors (e.g.
(TP) `xterm-256color`), although that's probably already the case, as the `xterm` + `screen` pair shouldn't cause issues.

(TP) you can use this snippet to check if your `TERM` supports 256 colors:

```bash
#!/bin/bash

echo "TERM is set to ${TERM}."

echo -n 'COLORTERM is '
[ -n "$COLORTERM" ] && echo "set to ${COLORTERM}."
|| echo 'not set.'

echo "Colors: $(tput colors)"
```

title: suggestion: formula.rb should require hardware.rb
body: (FPD) The `install` method gets hardware.rb support from somewhere, but `Hardware` isn't in the scope of the DSL.

(TPD) This means formulae which need it need to:

````
require 'formula'
require 'hardware'
````

suggest that formula.rb should just up-front require hardware.rb so we can remove these extra imports.
(FP) agreed.
Sounds sensible.
Done in dfcc838b6640466dced2d51b8c31299af3f52940

title: [Question] How to find firewall name for current route
body:
(FPD) Hi everyone,
probably a dumb question, but:

I have a kernel.response listener, I need to get firewall configuration for current route.
As I see firewalls are also kernel listeners, so there's no particular factory / repository for them.
(FPD) Path / pattern matching is a bit tricky too (since it's needed to extract path from firewall config, compile as a route, try to match against current route and so on).
So, what's the proposed way of determining current firewall having container, request and all firewall configs in kernel listener?
Thank you.
Please ask questions on the [forum](http://forum.symfony-project.org/) or the #symfony IRC channel on freenode.
Usually best way to discuss problems is the [mailing list](http://groups.google.com/group/symfony2) but it's not available atm...
Sorry, closed.

title: Modular layouts
body: (TPD) This is a demonstration to show why i think we should try modularize our layout.
(TPD) It's not as clean as I hoped since we're using two CSS frameworks at the same time, another thing we should change ASAP.
(TPD) The second commit shows how easy it is to add/remove parts to a page with such an appraoch.

any regressions or problems visually?
Nothing serous I could find, but someone else clicking through all pages couldn't do any harm :)
looks like it's time for the [screenshot tool](http://wiki.diaspora-project.org/wiki/Screenshot_tool) !

:P

But from what I could tell there's nothing completly broken.
@MrZYX now that I am looking at the single post view, I'll be happy to see that merged and the code refactored, it would help !

@MrZYX was there anything missing or unfinished?
Well, there are some slight glitches in this, mainly in the SPV.

one baby step at a time :)
Did you mean you still could do those things or you already did them?
(FP) ... (otherWISE) we could merge ;)
I already did.
(TP) ok, then let's just merge and then build the new SPV and everything else on top of this.

title: Where to check H5BP version number?
body: Coming back to an old project, I can't for the life of me figure out how to find which version of H5BP the project is using.
Is the version stored anywhere within a project?
(FND) If not it would be really useful to add this somewhere, like inside humans.txt perhaps.
I don't think we have it anywhere at the moment.
Mathias, got any ideas… package.json?
(FN) What about as a comment at the top of the index file?

```
<!doctype html>
<!-- paulirish.com/2008/conditional-stylesheets-vs-css-hacks-answer-neither/ -->
<!--[if lt IE 7]> <html class="no-js lt-ie9 lt-ie8 lt-ie7" lang="en"> <!

[endif]-->
<!--[if IE 7]>    <html class="no-js lt-ie9 lt-ie8" lang="en"> <!

[endif]-->
<!--[if IE 8]>    <html class="no-js lt-ie9" lang="en"> <!

[endif]-->
<!--[if gt IE 8]><!--> <html class="no-js" lang="en"> <!--<!

[endif]-->
<head>
  <meta charset="utf-8">
  <!-- H5BP VERSION: 3.0 -->
```
(TP) package.json sounds good, but this would mean that we would have to add one and I'm not sure if we should do this, as not everybody needs and/or uses it.
(FN) Using the node build script generates a package.json for you, maybe we could add the version number there.

(FN) /cc @mklabs

A comment in HTML would be the most obvious thing for everyone.
(TP) In my opinion this isn't the best way either, as it adds extra markup and apart from that we don't have any other options or information stored there.
(TP) I would suggest to integrate the version number in styles.css.
(FN) We already have a short introduction which who is responsible for all the good things in it and the project's name, so why not adding the version here?
Plus WordPress for instance also has some information about a theme stored in the stylesheet.
(TP) Apart from that I wonder whether it's that useful to know which version you are currently using.
I can only speak for me but when I update "old" projects I mostly focus on jQuery, Modernizr, my own scripts and .htaccess.
(TP) I don't try to change the styles because this could affect the styles I wrote, too.
But sure… adding this little number somewhere could help some people and it's not breaking anything or so.

@drublic 

> Apart from that I wonder whether it's that useful to know which version you are currently using.
(FP) i think it's good practice.
(TP) For instance I was trying to use the /js/modules feature of the build script, but it wasn't working.
(TP) I'm *pretty sure* this is because that feature hadn't been added yet back when we shipped this... but I also wasn't sure if it was user error on my part.
In situations like this a version # would be really handy for troubleshooting.
What about as a comment at the top of the index file?

<!doctype html>
    <!-- H★BP 3.0  -->
    <!-- paulirish.com/2008/conditional-stylesheets-vs-css-hacks-answer-neither/ -->
    <!--[if lt IE 7]> <html class="no-js lt-ie9 lt-ie8 lt-ie7" lang="en"> <!

[endif]-->
    <!--[if IE 7]>    <html class="no-js lt-ie9 lt-ie8" lang="en"> <!

[endif]-->
    <!--[if IE 8]>    <html class="no-js lt-ie9" lang="en"> <!

[endif]-->
    <!--[if gt IE 8]><!--> <html class="no-js" lang="en"> <!--<!

[endif]-->
    <head>
        <meta charset="utf-8">

just kidding with the "★" (though it does validate).
Why not have it in the `humans.txt` file?
You already have a giant star.
A simple `3.0` or something wouldn't hurt.
@shancat +1
[humanstxt](humanstxt.org/humans.txt) have a `Last update:` field.
I don't see why that couldn't be `Version:` in this case.
Inside humans.txt the main `Last update` and `Version` keys should reference the site state itself.
(TP) Maybe use an extra h5bp section where (YOU COULD) store h5bp related information.
(TP) As for the reason this was posted, it should also be possible for the build script to check versions.
(TP) That needs version hints available via json/js in the build script and the processed files.
+1 for in `humans.txt`
+1 to humans.txt.

(FN) What about simply putting it under the site portion of the humans.txt

Standards: HTML5, CSS3
Components: Modernizr, jQuery
Version: H5BP Ver 3.0
Software: ...
(FN) @lrsjng how about appending it to the `Components` section of humans.txt?

(TP) ```
Components: Modernizr, jQuery, H5BP v3.0
```

But as I understand there isn't really a solid spec for humans.txt files, so couldn't you just add a custom comment somewhere?
(TP) In #1140 @necolas submitted a PR with Grunt included, just if you haven't seen it.
(TP) This PR would also (REsolve) this bug as we would include a package.json file which has the version number included.

(FN) If this PR isn't suspected to be of enough value for this project at the moment I'd stick to my proposal of including the version-number in the `main.css`-file as it already has some information about the project.
(TP) Including the version-number in humans.txt would also make sense to me.
Added a changeLOG.
In the future, it should be clear from looking at that file.
Thanks

title: Proposal to fix #3079 (span_near query should accept slop = -1)
body: (TPD) This pull request changes the default slop value from -1 to Integer.MIN_VALUE (in SpanNearQueryParser.java).
The bug remains (i.e.
(FPD) you can specify slop = -2147483648, and the SpanNearQueryParser will raise error "span_near must include [slop]"), but unlike -1, I'm not aware of any case where such a slop value is useful.
(TP) can we just make it an Integer and initialise it with `null` and check for null to raise the exception?
(TP) updated to use null check as suggested.
merged, thanks

title: Python-JS bridge
body:
(FND) _**[jtla...@gmail.com](http://code.google.com/u/100187135505621010437/) commented:**_
> Feature request:
> 
> It would be rather useful to have a way to get the results from PhamtomJS for Python when using Python version of PJS.

**Disclaimer:**
This issue was migrated on 2013-03-15 from the project's former issue tracker on Google Code, [Issue #259](http://code.google.com/p/phantomjs/issues/detail?id=259).
:star2:   **2** people had starred this issue at the time of migration.

_**[roejame...@gmail.com](http://code.google.com/u/108946561510443272725/) commented:**_
> What exactly do you mean?
(FP) Can you clarify what you're saying?

(FN) _**[jtla...@gmail.com](http://code.google.com/u/100187135505621010437/) commented:**_
> So on top of running PhamtomJS scripts from Python I would also like to get the printouts back to Python.
(TP) One practical example would be to run readability's JS based parser from Python code against a website and return the parsed data to Python.
(FP) Does that make sense?
On Monday, October 10, 2011 at 10:32 AM, phantomjs@googlecode.com wrote:

_**[roejame...@gmail.com](http://code.google.com/u/108946561510443272725/) commented:**_
> > ... and return the parsed data to Python.

(TP) > 
> I'm still not sure exactly what you're asking for, but there's always the option for you to make your own custom PyPhantomJS plugin, using the plugin API.
(TP) I provided the plugin API as an easy way to extend the core program to provide custom features, should it be needed.

> 
> http://dev.umaclan.com/projects/pyphantomjs/wiki/Writing_plugins
> 
> Are you trying to use PyPhantomJS WITH a python script, and communicate that way?
(TP) If so, PyPhantomJS was only made for executing JS, just like it's counterpart PhantomJS.
(TP) But like I said above, you can create a plugin for your specific need.

(FP) > 
> http://code.google.com/p/phantomjs/wiki/FAQ
> 
> This will most likely be marked as Wont fix, unless I can better understand your use case, and it fits with the goals of the project.

(FP) We aren't able to implement every users specific need, (otherWISE) there'd be a lot of bloat and features in the software that no one else can use; but this is what the plugin API is for afterall.

(TP) > 
> If you'd like to better help me understand what you want, some code samples of what you're trying to do, how you'd like to solve the problem, and why it doesn't currently work, would be useful.

(FP) _**[jtla...@gmail.com](http://code.google.com/u/100187135505621010437/) commented:**_
> Thanks, I somehow missed the hooks (probably because there's really no proper examples).
(TP) I still hope that there would be a synchronous way to return data from JS run as it would make writing stuff on top of Python really handy (e.g.
(FN) when saving a link, fire up PyPhantom to query pages title and favicon info using jQuery calls and return that for Python).

(TP) _**[roejame...@gmail.com](http://code.google.com/u/108946561510443272725/) commented:**_
> This will likely be solved for you by my implementation of a Python API for PyPhantomJS.
(FP) I've already started work on it, but there's A LOT of work to be done, and I've been busy, so I can't guarantee how soon it will get done, or if it will ever get done for that matter.
(TP) In the meantime, I'm marking this as Wontfix.
Enjoy the plugin API!

(TP) :)

   
_**Metadata updates**_
 - **Status updated:** Wontfix

(TP) _**[roejame...@gmail.com](http://code.google.com/u/108946561510443272725/) commented:**_
> By the way, if you need something that works in Python NOW, you might try out Spynner instead, which natively supports a Python API.

> 
> https://github.com/rndbit/spynner

title: updating to rails3.0.19 from rails3.0.10 gives rails_autolink dependency error
body:
on updating to rails3.0.19
i got rails_autolink gem dependency
Gemfile and Gemfile.lock doesn't contain rails_autolink gem

> bundle update

Bundler could not find compatible versions for gem "rails":
  In Gemfile:
    rails_autolink (>= 1.0) depends on
      rails (~> 3.1.0)

    rails (3.0.19)
(TP) `rails_autolink` has to be somewhere, (otherWISE) it would not check that and blow up.
(TP) This gem was extracted from Rails 3.1, so 3.0.x should not need it.
(FN) In any case, I recommend you asking for some help in the Rails Talk mailing list, stack overflow, or irc.
Thanks.

title: [Validator] UniqueEntity issue
body: (FPD) I'm using UniqueEntity validation in a form and it works fine.

```php

/**
  * @ORM\ManyToOne(targetEntity="Gateway", inversedBy="access_lists")
  * @ORM\JoinColumn(name="gateway_id", referencedColumnName="id", onDelete="CASCADE")
  */

private $gateway;

```

BUT when i try to validate manually I get no error.
The fields are populated correctly, I checked the values.
(FPD) It accepts duplicate records.
(FP) are you creating a duplicate with the same 3 fields ?
(FN) Putting several fields in the UniqueEntity validation means validating the set of fields as being unique, not each individual fields as being unique.
(TP) To validate 3 unique fields, you need 3 constraints (one for each)
Yes, it has the same three fields.
That is the right configuration.
(TP) The odd thing is that using in form t works fine.
It is my fault my data are not right.

title: Content-Type Header not respected on post
body:
Line of issue: 
https://github.com/restsharp/RestSharp/blob/master/RestSharp/Http.cs#L277

* webRequest.ContentType = "application/x-www-form-urlencoded";

When attempting a post to WCF service endpoint, the content-type value provided is not being respected.
(TPD) There are two possible solutions that could be applied.

(TPD) * A content-type header if not provided is not attempted to be placed on the request under any method type
* If a post method type is provided and no content-type is provided, then the content type of "application/x-www-form-urlencoded" should be placed on the header

I believe #1 to be the best solution since there is no specification that an HTTP POST MUST include a Content-Type header This line causes any specific post content-type header applied to the request to be over-ridden.
(TPD) In the process of a WCF endpoint evaluation, the request is being refused because the content-type is not representative of the body content.

(FND) Message received from WCF service:

* The incoming message has an unexpected message format 'Raw'.
(FND) The expected message formats for the operation are 'Xml', 'Json'.
(TPD) This can be because a WebContentTypeMapper has not been configured on the binding.
(TPD) See the documentation of WebContentTypeMapper for more details.
(FND)  A request with a restSharp client fails and looks like this.

-----------------------------
REQUEST:
POST http://localhost.partnerapi.testsite.com/lightbox/?access_token=bee9fd3f-7a16-4dc0-8102-ca5c2e566060 HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/JSON
Content-Type: application/x-www-form-urlencoded
Cotent-Length: 27
Host: localhost.partnerapi.testsite.com

{
"LightboxName":"cats"
}

RESPONSE:
HTTP/1.1 500 INTERNAL SERVER ERROR
Cache-Control: private
Server: Microsoft-IIS/7.5
X-AspNet-Version: 4.0.30319
X-Powered-By: ASP.NET
Date: Tue, 14 Feb 2012 00:42:09 GMT
Content-Length: ...[TRUNCATED for illustration]

-----------------------------

A successful request to the endpoint looks like this.

-----------------------------
REQUEST:
POST http://localhost.partnerapi.testsite.com/lightbox/?access_token=bee9fd3f-7a16-4dc0-8102-ca5c2e566060 HTTP/1.1
Accept: application/JSON
Content-Type: application/JSON
Cotent-Length: 27
Host: localhost.partnerapi.testsite.com

{
"LightboxName":"cats"
}

RESPONSE:
HTTP/1.1 200 OK
Cache-Control: private
Server: Microsoft-IIS/7.5
X-AspNet-Version: 4.0.30319
X-Powered-By: ASP.NET
Date: Tue, 14 Feb 2012 00:42:09 GMT
Content-Length: 0

-----------------------------
(FN) To control the content type, use AddBody().
(TP) Register your own ISerializer implementation if you need to override the defaults.
(FN) See the very last section here: https://github.com/restsharp/RestSharp/wiki/Deserialization
Thanks for replying on this.
(TP) After a bunch of experiments and reviewing of code processes I have found the solution I need.
http://itanex.blogspot.com/2012/02/restsharp-and-advanced-post-requests.html

title: Restricted access on Symfony2 Google Group ?
body:
Hello,

Sorry, i know it's not the right place for this question but I don't know where to ask about this issue regarding the Symfony2 Google Group.

When we access the Symfony2 Google Groups
https://groups.google.com/forum/?fromgroups#!forum/Symfony2
my colleagues and I get the following error message:
"Vous n'êtes pas autorisé à accéder à ce contenu.

(# 418 )"
and no content is displayed.

(FPD) I had subscribed to the group more than one year ago, so I don't know what happens here and don't know where to find help about it :(

Is it possible that the restriction is done based on black listed IP address ?
Thanks in advance for your help.

Best regards,
Christophe
(TP) It should be fixed now https://twitter.com/fabpot/status/321943450259972096
It's available now, thank you !

title: need method to add default headers to all API requests.
body: (FND) It would be very convenient to have a method which adds default headers to all API requests.

(TPD) Maybe something like:

    s3 = boto.s3_connect(....)
    bucket = s3.get_bucket("....")
    bucket.set_default_headers({'x-amz-request-payer': 'requester'})

This should probably be added to the other AWS services as well, since they all accept headers too.
(TP) It'd be possible to subclass any of the built-in ``boto`` connection classes & add this.
(TP) Unfortunately, we've not had many other requests for this.
Closing.

title: Add help option to form fields
body:
(TPD) Bug fix: no
Feature addition: yes
Backwards compatibility break: no
Symfony2 tests pass: yes

It adds a help option to form field types as basic described here
http://toni.uebernickel.info/2011/11/25/how-to-extend-form-fields-in-symfony2.html
http://symfony.com/doc/2.0/cookbook/form/form_customization.html#adding-help-messages

Now you can pass the help option in the form type
```
$builder->add('message', 'textarea', array('help' => 'Enter your bug describtion here'));
```
(TP) Why would we want to add such a feature as you can do it easily in your code?
(TP) i think help message for a form field is a must have.
(TP) Yes, It is a small change, but i think it is hard to implement in every project/bundle.
(TP) So i think the core should support form field help messages.
(TP) Help messages are very diverse, depending a lot of the implementation, from simple text to complex floating tooltips...
(TP) i think is better to have them customized in your own implementations.
(TP) The PR is about the support for help messages.
(FP) Not the UI implementation.
(TP) you can simple override the block ```field_help``` to add your markup.
(FN) @gimler simply contribute a FormTypeExtension in SimpleThingsFormExtraBundle for this.
(TP) So people wanting this feature can use the bundle

:-1:

This can go nicely in a bundle.
(FP) I don't think we should be adding more support for text meant for display in the type class.
The best practice is to provide this text in a template, as described in the cookbook.
(FP) +1 i think this is a good idea and a usefull addition.

(FP) Being able to quickly add help information to a form without having to spend 1 - 2 hours setting it up in the project and having to handcode something that is so often usefull seems a win for me.
(TP) I would accept this for SimpleThingsFormExtraBundle, i actually have exactly this code in a project of mine and wanted to make this into the bundle some time.
Would be cool if you PR it.
:+1: for this to get PR into SimpleThingsFormExtraBundle.
(TP) ok i will make a PR for SimpleThingsFormExtraBundle
(FN) HTML5 has also placeholder attribute for this kind of behavior.
(FP) i think that's a standard feature of a good form component.
(FP) It's a must for daily business works.
Bad that @fabpot and @kriswallsmith not have the same opinion.
This code should be part of core!
This code was merged into SimpleThingsFormExtraBundle.
(FP) @MasterB I disagree, if you sit 100 peoples in a room and normally everybody has a different opinion on what should be into core then you end up with a messy huge framework.
Symfony2 is easily pluggable for a reason.
(FP) @beberlei I'm agree with you most of them.
But I dont like to load my Project with tons of 3prty Bundles for really basic things.

Thanks.

I'll try to get to this over the weekend.
The master branch is now upgraded to Thrift 0.7.0.

title: odb: check if object exists before writing
body: This may have a significant impact on the performance of the tree builder.
Isn't this the exactly opposite of what they are telling on the git mailinglist about git behavior in case an object with a already known SHA1 arrives?

(TP) I don't have a reference at hand right now, but if i remember correctly it should be: If the object to write hashes to a hash value we already know, then and _only then_ instead of skiping the write, compare the object byte by byte.
(TP) The object isn't arriving from the network, we're creating it.
In that case this looks good - of course - and I can silently crawl back under that rock over there...
> This may have a significant impact on the performance of the tree builder.
May?
I'd like to see some numbers about this.
The idea of re-hashing the buffer twice doesn't sound that appealing to me.
(FN) Ideally, we should re-use the first hash when writing the loose object to the ODB.
(TP) @vmg, I agree, if we apply this it'd be worth adjusting the backends as well to avoid double-hashing.
(FP) I don't have a good benchmark right now because my application is also persisting a lot of blobs and hammering the index.
@vmg Now without double hashing and with an update to `odb_backend.h`.
:smile:
I now have three PRs that significantly impact import performance.
(FN) When I'm back at my workstation, I'll benchmark the combinations with the first N thousand revisions of the ASF repository.
Where N is such that the benchmark completes in half an hour without the PRs.
@vmg I present some numbers.
The system was a bit noisy but with nearly 2 orders of magnitude between fastest and slowest, the noise is insignificant.

Baseline (9420 commits):

    546.96user 1251.97system 30:24.33elapsed 98%CPU (0avgtext+0avgdata 264328maxresident)k

title: incremental compile dependency check is very slow
body: (FPD) Running the compile on a multi-project build with no changes is very slow (around 30+ seconds).
(TPD) I ran yourkit on it, the patch below takes my time down to 1 second.
Oops.
(FP) I was running from the wrong sub-project after the change.
It still cuts the time down to 10 seconds.
(TP) Profiling again after the above change shows most of the time spent in SameAPI.
It looks like it's comparing all the "external" sources.
(FN) Shouldn't the stamps be checked first?
Thanks
That part of the code (in Execute) is only used for assertions.
(TP) (YOU COULD) also try disabling all assertions completely.
(TP) (In the build, change the argument to -Xelide-below to something like 3000).
What stamps are you talking about?
(TP) The Source objects it seems to be checking are dependencies from my other sub-projects.
(TP) Given that sbt already checked for changes in that dependent sub-project, it seems like sbt shouldn't have to to run through the SameAPI.apply to do the explicit check.
I was looking at the Analysis class and saw the stamps, I assumed they were used to shortcut external dependency checks as well as internal, binary and product.
(But I now see they are not).
(FP) Does that make sense?
(TP) I'd really like to get the SameAPI checks down, as right now it's faster to do an old xsbt compile when nothing's changed...
I've been looking at wrapping the Source objects with a file hash to shortcut the checks, do you think that's a productive avenue?
Thanks again
The problem is that source file hashes are insufficient.
(TP) It is possible for a class file from the same source file to be different due to binary or source dependencies changing.
Source tracks this information.
(TP) Now, (YOU COULD) hash all class files that came from the source.
(TP) i think that will work.
I don't know how expensive that will be, though.
(TP) As for why it checks the api in other projects, consider projects A and B, with B depending on A.
(TP) B needs to know the Source for A when B was last compiled, not when A was last compiled.
(TP) It isn't important whether the source files for A have changed or not.
(TP) What is important is whether the Source has changed since the last time B was compiled.
(FP) make sense?

(TP) If you are sure the API comparison is a bottleneck, we can probably generate a unique ID for each API when it's created and use that to shortcut things for the common case where the API hasn't changed at all.
(TP) If you want to look at doing this, let me know.
(FP) (otherWISE), I'll do it.
(FP) Either way, thanks for the work you have done so far on this.
(FP) Thanks, that makes a bit of sense.
I'll have to poke around a bit more to get my head around it completely.
(FP) I'm pretty sure that's the bottleneck, but I'll re-benchmark as soon as I finish porting the plugins I need.
Thanks again!
(FP) In my case, it takes 7 seconds for a build with no changes.
(FP) Scott, have you made any progress since your last message?
I've started a branch playing around with some optimizations related to this and memory consumption, but haven't had time to touch it in awhile.

See:
https://github.com/harrah/xsbt/issues/21
The idea to uniquely identify APIs and shortcut the checking is a solid idea.
The main problem is figuring out how to generate the unique ID.
(TP) The best option I see so far is to combine the hash of the source with the time at which compilation was performed.
(FP) I will try to implement this today.
(FP) Mark, did you notice any difference with this change?
My initial testing shows no difference.
I used a version I compiled myself from the v0.9.10 tag, but I'll try again later with the binary from the Maven repository.

(TP) Btw, it seems like 0.9.10 is missing for the scripted plugin:

http://typesafe.artifactoryonline.com/typesafe/ivy-releases/org.scala-tools.sbt/scripted-plugin_2.8.1/
Yeah, it's missing.
Ah, sorry.
(FP) I ran publish from the wrong subproject (Simple Build Tool instead of the root project).
I'd have to push a new release.
Is this worth it for you?
Sure, I'll build myself.
(TP) I've checked this out and as far as I can tell it is working properly.
(FP) After fixing some weird build/sync issues.
My time has gone down on my laptop from ~10 seconds to 5-6 seconds.
(which is great!

(TP) I will take ~2x)

Looking at the remaining time, a bunch seems to be in sbinary writing stuff?

The call path is something like:
sbt.Tracked$$anonfun$inputchanged$1.apply(Object)
sbt.Tracked$$anonfun$lastOutput$1.apply(Object)
sbt.CacheIO$.toFile(Object, File, Format, Manifest)

title: Getting error when using @include <map>-sprite(<spritename>) in Media Query
body: (TPD) You may only @extend selectors within the same directive.
This will be an error in Sass 3.3.
(TPD) It can only work once @extend is supported natively in the browser.

(FPD) I find this language confusing because as far as I understand, I am not using an @extend; but also it is not clear to me why I should not be able to @extend inside of a media query, even if I were.
Anyhelp would be great!!

(TP) `You may only @extend selectors within the same directive.` 

its trying to extend a class outside of the `@media` selector which isn't possible.
(TP) So what your trying to do isn't possible you will need to more the sprite import inside the `@media` selector if you what that to work.
@scottdavis thanks for the response.
(FP) I am trying to understand what you said, and i think I get it.
(TP) I guess what is happening is that the sprite import dumps out a bunch of classes which then my attempt to @include in the media query involves @extend-ing.
And for some reason that is not allowed?
(FP) Ok, so if that is the case, I am just wondering how the solution you suggested would work?
(TP) Would it not end up creating a huge number of unnecessary and repetetive classes, the very thing that SASS is designed to avoid?
What's the best practice way to achieve what I'm trying to do, which is basically to use COMPASS/SASS to manage sprites within a responsive design?
(FP) I have been trying to work on a solution to this problem as well.
The issue is that the foldername-sprite mixin contains an extend which applies the actual background image to all of the sprite classes using that spritemap.
(TP) What I would like to see is an option to turn that extend off and rather just include the background property with the selector itself, in whatever directive it happens to be in.
(TP) The current solution is to either call the foldername-sprite mixin outside of any media query and then hide it until the media query that you need it (pretty annoying, but doable.).
(TP) The other solution is to use the sprite() function which will output the proper background properties for whatever sprite-map and sprite you pass to it.
(TP) why not just reimport the sprite within the media query?
(TP) it shouldn't slow anything down since its already generated.
(FP) @scottdavis is it possible to @import "sprites/*" from inside a media query?

(TP) The solution I ended up choosing was to just overwrite the @include folder-sprites(spritename){ } mixin after calling @import "sprites/*" and rewrite it to just set the background property, rather than extending.
(TP) Sure, it's a little more code, but it sure is simpler to implement.
(FP) I don't know why it wouldn't be possible.

On Thu, Feb 7, 2013 at 11:13 AM, Micah Godbolt <notifications@github.com>wrote:

> @scottdavis <https://github.com/scottdavis> is it possible to @import<https://github.com/import>"sprites/*" from inside a media query?

>
> The solution I ended up choosing was to just overwrite the @include<https://github.com/include>folder-sprites(spritename){ } mixin after calling
> @import <https://github.com/import> "sprites/*" and rewrite it to just
> set the background property, rather than extending.

Sure, it's a little
> more code, but it sure is simpler to implement.

>
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub<https://github.com/chriseppstein/compass/issues/1147#issuecomment-13243105>.

title: Added BITPOS command
body: (FND) I added a `BITPOS` operation to Redis, which accepts `[start end limit]` arguments.
(TPD) As the name suggests, it operates on bit strings and returns the positions (offsets) of all the set bits.
(TPD) My C is a little rusty, so it might need a little review/(IMPROVE)ments.
(TP) The lack of explicit memory allocation and validation in this patch crashes Redis, especially on large bit sets.

(TP) As a temporary, intermediate, array of set bit positions isn't actually required, this patch eliminates the crash behavior as well as exhibits substantially (IMPROVE)d performance (by eliminating the allocation).
(FN) If you're still using the command, please check it out: https://github.com/antirez/redis/pull/1295

title: scope chain broken
body:
(FPD) Hi, following chain is not working as expect:

```
$ rails c
Loading development environment (Rails 3.2.1)
irb(main):001:0> f = Foo.where('id=1')
  Foo Load (7.2ms)  select "foos".

* FROM "foos" WHERE (id=1)
=> []
irb(main):002:0> f.to_sql
=> "select \"foos\".

* FROM \"foos\"  WHERE (id=1)"
irb(main):003:0> f.where('id=2')
  Foo Load (4.0ms)  select "foos".

* FROM "foos" WHERE (id=1) AND (id=2)
=> []
irb(main):004:0> f.to_sql
=> "select \"foos\".

* FROM \"foos\"  WHERE (id=1)"
irb(main):005:0> 

```

In (003) add new where scope chain, and output can see "WHERE (id=1)  AND (id=2)" but if run to get  ".to_sql"  we can see it's not maintaining correct sql query on the ActiveRelation instance.
(TP) Surely you need to capture the result of the second where?

irb> f = Foo.where('id=1')
      Foo Load (1.2ms)  select "foos".

* FROM "foos" WHERE (id=1)
    => [] 
    irb> f.to_sql
    => "select \"foos\".

* FROM \"foos\"  WHERE (id=1)" 
    irb> f2 = f.where('id=2')
      Foo Load (0.6ms)  select "foos".

* FROM "foos" WHERE (id=1) AND (id=2)
    => [] 
    irb> f.to_sql
    => "select \"foos\".

* FROM \"foos\"  WHERE (id=1)" 
    irb> f2.to_sql
    => "select \"foos\".
* FROM \"foos\"  WHERE (id=1) AND (id=2)"
I expects second where be added to the receiver ARelation, not instanciating another ARelation copy.
(TP) I believe it's the behavior of ARelation, you can plug different scope at different times on the same instance, and query will be adapted.
(TP) Then for each scope chain, needs new instance???
(FP) it's seem rare
(TP) This is correct behavior, scope does not change the object that you're calling it on.
Ok, thanks for the clarification

title: Use of "accounts" instead of "services" to describe Twitter, Facebook, etc.
body: A new user sees "You have no accounts configured.

(FPD) Set up an account now→" The word "account" here is ambiguous, since the user has a *ThinkUp* account already, and context doesn't indicate that ThinkUp considers Twitter & Facebook to be "accounts".
(TPD) Easiest suggestion I can think of is that we consistently refer to supported sources of updates as "Services", since that's how they're clearly referred to in other similar apps.
(TPD) other option, since we're already preferring the Twitter plugin, is that we should skip this screen entirely and just send users right to the setup page for Twitter.
Yep, good call.
(TP) The entire app needs a thorough audit for sensible names/labels for things, and consistency throughout.
I'll do this.
(FP) Any other places where this should be corrected?

(TP) Thanks for submitting this patch:
https://github.com/JWFoxJr/ThinkUp/commit/f3e8e2ca60a4d6dbcb295433397356f93557eabf

But i think the revised messaging there is too long, and we want to avoid passive voice ("you will be taken to a dashboard") wherever possible.

(FN) How about:

You have no plugins configured.

(FN) Set up a plugin now to add your Twitter or Facebook account to ThinkUp>>

With a link around "Set up a plugin now."
Whoops.
I had forgotten all about this, sorry.
Glad that JWFoxJr is doing it now ;)

(TP) Issue #189: fixed "no plugin object defined" error
* When deactivating a plugin with active instances, those instances are automatically deactivated and the cache gets cleared, so those instances don't show up in the switch user dropdown and no longer cause a "no plugin object defined" error

In this fix, several related issues were also (REsolve)d:

Issue #585: Added support for plugin activate/deactivate callbacks
* Added FacebookPlugin and TwitterPlugin deactivate callbacks to deactivate related instances

title: [mdnsembedded] - fix zeroconfbrowser
body: As pointed out in the former pull request which added zeroconf support for android by utilising mdnsembedded - the zeroconfbrowser was deactivated because browsing worked - but resolving into an ip didn't.

I tracked it down to the following reason:

1.
(FPD)  In the (REsolve) callback we used our CDNSNameCache to (REsolve) the hostname - which always failed on android (for example our CDNSNameCache was not able to (REsolve) DockStar.local.
(FPD) to an ip) - not sure why it works on windows - but gethostbyname definitly doesn't (REsolve) .local domains on my odroid-x.

(TPD) I solved it by:

1.

(TPD) Moving the DNSCache out of the callback into the zeroconfthread (else the callback could stall and timeout)
2.

(TPD) Falling back to the mdns (REsolve)r (DNSServiceGetAddrInfo) when our CDNSNameCache fails

This PR also bumps the version of mdnsresponder to the latest.
(TPD) Speed of browsing is now same as on all other implementations (before it lasted about 5 secs before the list showed up).
(FPD) @wsoltys do you think we even need the CDNSNameCache?
(TPD) Imo it would be sufficient to leave the resolution of local.
(TPD) hostnames to mdns completly - it caches aswell and is able to (REsolve) those local domains without issues.
(TPD) Would be cool if (YOU COULD) give it a shot (just comment out the call to CDNSNameCache::Lookup in ZeroconfBrowserMDNS.cpp and see if it works on windows aswell...
(TPD) This fixes zeroconfbrowser support for android and therefor completes zeroconf support.

(TPD) (and i consider this a fix and want to pull it as soon as i get the sign-off by @wsoltys ...)

@TheUni - we need the multicastlock for wifi networks then ;)
updated so that it defaults to mdns resolving and falls back to CDNSNameCache if mdns fails.
(TP) This is the logical appraoch to me because mdns should have the addrinfo cached after service discovery already which should be faster (if even measureable).
(TP) I guess I just copied that from the old osx zeroconf browser.
(TP) it works fine without so go ahead.
Looks like that Android will be the least common denominator of our platforms in future?
Never say never ;) - maybe we can use some more of your windows code on android in the future ;)

(TP) @Memphiz: I'll handle the multicast lock, but I have a few things I need to finish up first before getting distracted again ;)

It's probably not going to be completely trivial, I'd prefer to get it in for the next window if that works for you.
Sure - i'm no android User - so i Don't really care ;)

title: syntax error for null column.type_cast_code
body: (FPD) In activerecord/lib/active_record/attribute_methods/read.rb define_read_method() if column.type_cast_code('v') returns nil then you get a syntax error when the code is evaluated because the resulting access_code ends with "&& ;"
type_case_code should never return nil.
Are you using mysql2 with edge rails by chance?
yes I am
(TP) If you're working against edge rails, please use edge mysql2.
(FN) We've moved the database adapter from mysql2 in to rails master.
(TP) That should fix this problem!
well I hate to be a pedant but this wasn't helpful.
(TP) I am not a rails core committer - just a rails user that hit a problem that others will hit and tried to be helpful with a 1 line fix.

(FN) Going by this quote from the Rails 3 release notes at http://guides.rubyonrails.org/3_0_release_notes.html

"On top of all that, we’ve tried our best to deprecate the old APIs with nice warnings.
(TP) That means that you can move your existing application to Rails 3 without immediately rewriting all your old code to the latest best practices."
(TP) I don't think it unreasonable to expect to be able to use the mysql2 gem with my rails 3 application.
(FP) I found zero info when searching for various combinations of "use edge mysql2".
So how do I how "use edge mysql2" with edge rails ?
(TP) and wouldn't it be better to include this simple 1 line fix that tests for this case rather than just blow up if things aren't the exact way you want them ?
(TP) The Rails Gemfile in master clearly works against the unreleased version of the mysql2 gem.
(TP) If you are going to work against edge rails, you need to work against the dependencies listed in our Gemfile.

title: [Finder] Added support for PHP callables for filters
body:
(TPD) Bug fix: no
Feature addition: yes
Backwards compatibility break: no
Symfony2 tests pass: yes
fixes the following tickets: -
Todo: -
License of the code: MIT
documentation PR: symfony/symfony-docs#2090
(FP) I don't like this change as this is a BC break and I don't really see the use case.
@fabpot do you really expect people to overwrite the ``filter`` method of the Finder class ?
It is nto a BC break when *using* the finder
(TP) @fabpot people can still use Closures, as it is a valid PHP callable.
I don't see the BC break?
@WouterJ BC break is if someone extended `Finder` class and overwrite the `filter()` method.

```diff
-    public function filter(\Closure $closure)
+    public function filter($closure)
The problem is that this method is marked with the `@api` tag and that we don't really respect its meaning.
(TP) As I don't see a big win breaking the API, I prefer to not do it... except if you have a use case in mind where using a closure is not possible/not desirable.
I have build a simple library that can search in files and outputs the files that contains a pattern or string.
(TP) I wanted to have a sort of 'extension' interface for that library, so you can make a new Filter and register it.
(FN) The library will the filters to the `Finder`.
(TP) I prefer to make those filters in a seperate class (e.g.
(FN) `GitIgnoreFileFilter`) and register the `filter` method of those classes to the `Finder`.
(TP) But I didn't see the `@api` tag, i think this is a too minor change to break BC.

(TP) The discussion here has brought me another solution: Extend the `Finder` class and update the `filter` method to accept PHP callables, the underlying class already accepts PHP callables, so this is easilly done.
Closing
(TP) After some research it looks like I am not able to change the `filter` method to support callables by extending the `Finder` class and overriding it.
(TP) Then I thought, I will change the method that uses the `$filter` property to make it use the `$filter` property in the `MyFinder` class.
(TP) But I cannot override that method (`Finder::searchInDirectory()`) because it is private too!
How can we override this?
(TP) Can we change one of the 2 `private` to `protected`?
Or should we reopen this PR and merge it?
(FP) @pqr thank you, I don't know why I haven't thought about that solution!

title: Add tests for supporting query parameters on the controller (REsolve)r.
body: (TPD) There are many usescase where you not only want to have inject request attributes but also request query parameters.

(TPD) one example: In Drupal a pager looks like that: foo?page=1

| Q             | A
| ------------- | ---
| Bug fix?

| no
| New feature?

| yes
| BC breaks?

| no
| Deprecations?

| no
| Tests pass?

| yes
| License       | MIT
(FP) We explicitly do not inject request parameters and we don't want to.
This new feature has been requested many times and rejected for security reasons.
It we do that, a user can potentially inject anything.
What else would be the recommended way to deal with things like the ?page, pull it manually from the request object?
(TP) If you inject the request object in the controller, then just do something like `$request->query->get('page')` and filter it before using it (like casting it to an integer in this case).
(TP) Sure this always work.
(TP) At least in Drupal we try to get away from using the full request in our controllers if possible.
Fabien, can you explain how it's a security issue?
(FP) We're likely to add it in Drupal specifically if it's not supported upstream, but if it opens a security hole that becomes problematic.
Please explain.

title: Invisible Key (only visible from LUA)
body: I've got the following LUA zunion script (soon available on [Redsmin](http://bit.ly/QrFhUt)).

(please note that I added debug calls)

```lua
-- zunion numkeys key [key ..] [REVRANGE start stop [EXPIRE expire]]
-- extended zunion - MIT LICENSE
-- v1.1 - Only save what was requested
-- https://redsmin.com http://brin.gr

local expire = 5*60 -- expire after 5 minutes
local lgth   = #KEYS
local start  = 0
local stop   = -1

-- debug
redis.call('zadd', 'debug', 0, "start");

if(#ARGV > 0) then
  if(ARGV[1] == 'REVRANGE') then
    start = tonumber(ARGV[2]) or start
    stop  = tonumber(ARGV[3]) or stop
  end

  if(#ARGV > 3 and ARGV[4] == 'EXPIRE') then
    expire = tonumber(ARGV[5]) or expire
  end
end

-- debug
redis.call('zadd', 'debug', 1, 'start ' .. start .. ' stop '.. stop .. ' expire ' .. expire);

-- Define the key name
local name = 'zunion:' .. start .. ':' .. stop .. ':' ..redis.sha1hex(table.concat(KEYS))

local function getResults()
 local range =  redis.call('zrevrange', name, start, stop, 'WITHSCORES')
 return range
end


-- debug
local r = redis.call('exists', name)
redis.call('zadd', 'debug', 2, 'exists ' .. name .. ' = '.. r);

-- If the key already exist returns it
if redis.call('exists', name) == 1 then
  return getResults()
end

-- debug
redis.call('zadd', 'debug', 3, 'zunionstore ' .. name .. ' '.. lgth);

-- do a zunionstore
table.insert(KEYS, 1, 'zunionstore')
table.insert(KEYS, 2, name)
table.insert(KEYS, 3, lgth)

redis.call(unpack(KEYS));

-- truncate, only keep from 'highest score' to stop
if stop > -1 then
  -- debug
  redis.call('zadd', 'debug', 4, 'zremrangebyrank ' .. name .. ' '.. 0 .. ' ' .. -stop-2);

  redis.call('zremrangebyrank', name, 0, -stop-2);
end

-- debug
redis.call('zadd', 'debug', 5, 'expire ' .. name .. ' '.. expire);

-- Add an expire
redis.call('expire', name, expire);

-- Return the key
return getResults()
```

In our case reads are always done on the slaves and because zunion has an internal cache, writes on the slave are allowed as well:

```
redis_version:2.6.4
role:slave
os:Linux 2.6.32-5-amd64 x86_64
slave_read_only:0
db0:keys=10566,expires=578
```

I restarted my Redis client to add the debug informations in LUA script and as you can see the `zunion:0:4:488003f1d62e2765f033db26187f093a1b68c073 ` key exists **from the LUA script point of view**:
!

[screenshots](http://i.imgur.com/5OsXz.png)

however if I try to access them from redis-cli (or in other words from the redis-protocol) they can't be listed even if  `exists` and `del` returns a valid value.

```shell
redis 127.0.0.1:6379> exists zunion:0:4:488003f1d62e2765f033db26187f093a1b68c073 
(integer) 1
redis 127.0.0.1:6379> ttl zunion:0:4:488003f1d62e2765f033db26187f093a1b68c073 
(integer) -1
redis 127.0.0.1:6379> keys zunion:*
(empty list or set)
redis 127.0.0.1:6379> del zunion:0:4:488003f1d62e2765f033db26187f093a1b68c073 
(integer) 1
redis 127.0.0.1:6379> 
```

Note: `ttl` returns -1 but it should return 300 or the specified `expire` value
Note: `keys zunion:*` should at least display `zunion:0:4:488003f1d62e2765f033db26187f093a1b68c073`

### [update]
-- [Removed] I proved that my hypothesis was wrong --

### [update2] 
I edited the script to directly remove the key afterwards and the script still works .
So the error seems to be with the expire & exists.

```lua
local expire = 5*60 -- expire after 5 minutes
local lgth   = #KEYS
local start  = 0
local stop   = -1

if(#ARGV > 0) then
  if(ARGV[1] == 'REVRANGE') then
    start = tonumber(ARGV[2]) or start
    stop  = tonumber(ARGV[3]) or stop
  end

  if(#ARGV > 3 and ARGV[4] == 'EXPIRE') then
    expire = tonumber(ARGV[5]) or expire
  end
end

-- Define the key name
local name = 'zunion:' .. start .. ':' .. stop .. ':' ..redis.sha1hex(table.concat(KEYS))

local function getResults()
  -- return the result from the biggest to the lowest
  local range =  redis.call('zrevrange', name, start, stop, 'WITHSCORES')
  redis.call('del', name)
  return range
end

-- If the key already exist returns it
if redis.call('exists', name) == 1 then
  return getResults()
end

-- do a zunionstore
table.insert(KEYS, 1, 'zunionstore')
table.insert(KEYS, 2, name)
table.insert(KEYS, 3, lgth)

redis.call(unpack(KEYS));

-- truncate, only keep from 'highest score' to stop
if stop > -1 then
  redis.call('zremrangebyrank', name, 0, -stop-2);
end

-- Return the key
return getResults()
```

### [update 3]
I updated *the first version* of the LUA script and added a `redis.call('expire', name, expire)` just after the ` local range =  redis.call('zrevrange', name, start, stop, 'WITHSCORES')` and now `keys zunion:*` finally returns all the matching keys with the right TTL.
[keys works !

(FPD) ](http://i.imgur.com/7Q978.png)

Am I missing something with `expire` behaviour ?
Or is it really a Redis/Lua bug ?

(TP) This is odd, but is the currently expected behavior... 

Basically what happens is that a slave is not authorized to expire a key, since the key eviction is driven by the master that sends explicit DEL commands to the slave.
(TP) however KEYS avoid showing you keys already expired.
(TP) At the same time the other commands are able to access the keys if the keys are used directly.
You may ask why the master is not sending the DEL command to the slave.

The reason is that when the key is not accessed in the master side by a client, only the background incremental collection performed by Redis can discover the key, and it takes time when there are many keys to sample from.
(TP) There is some idea to (IMPROVE) this by improving the expiration algorithm.

(TP) For instance an appraoch could be that instead of using random sampling we store the expire information on a skiplist instead of using an hashable (db->expires), so that we can simply traverse the skiplist to expire things older than the current time.
(TP) At the same time the skiplist can be used to add a new expire in O(1) time every time the expire has a time greater than any other expire currently set on Redis.
(TP) This is very common actually, because many applications use SETEX with a fixed TTL.
(FP) Taking this issue open until a new issue centered on this problem is open and properly documented.
First thanks for this detailed response!

(TP) however, few more points:
- the LUA script run on the slave, it creates its own "zunion:" keys (they are not present in the master keyspace, its the desired effect because these keys are only used for cache).

(TP) - `KEYS` was issued on the slave, not the master and I was able to see the TTL for each keys (as demonstrated in the last screenshot)

therefore I don't understand how this is even possible regarding the fact that slave are not authorized to expire keys.

It will not cause any error, but also needs to be fixed.
Try reflection or like ActionBar Compat by google?
(TP) We rely on the fact that it does not cause errors because most of the time it has to do with calls to the superclass implementation.
(TP) If we abstract any of those into static inner clases or (still static) high-level classes we have no way of calling into that superclass implementation.
(TP) Reflection in this case will also not work because of how polymorphism behaves in that it exists outside the instance of the class (and therefore has no way to call super).
Tricks like leveraging this behavior cannot be done with Android 1.6's class loader which is one of the main reasons that it was dropped.
The fact that the 2.x class loader simple replaces the offending code with "no op"s allows us certain behavior.
It sucks spamming the log like this, but we rely on its behavior for functionality.
(FP) thanks foryour reply.maybe I will fork your project and do some hack to solute this, then I'll give you a patch.
So you mean this error will not effect the performance of the app or crash the application?
@xDragonZ That is correct.
(TP) We use logic to ignore the blocks that are (otherWISE) being replaced by the classloader for containing invalid method calls.
(TP) since they're never reached it affects nothing.

title: AmbientLight No Longer works
body: Upgrading to r46 causes my ambient lights to be dark.
(TP) Ambient lighting works, just it's different from how it was before.
(FN) Before Lambert material didn't have `ambient` color property (before it was like if it had `0xffffff` ambient color).
(FN) Now Lambert is consistent with Phong and has `ambient` color (default to `0x050505`, like Phong, so it's darker compared to before).
(TP) Thanks, that works.

Only continue if there is a loaded comment with at least one reply.
Now fold the comment.
And unfold it again.
Suddenly the *source* and *save* links are repeated a dozen times.
When folding and unfolding the comment again, even more source links will appear.
The reddit UI doesn't have a source link.
Please report this issue to RES or whatever extension is providing that functionality.

title: fix when you model have different value for to_key
body: Hi!
I have very strange bug.

(FPD) for example:
I have a User model:
```lang=ruby
...
  def slug_url
    self.slug.presence || self.id.to_s
  end

  def to_key
    [slug_url]
  end
...
```
and users.slug is a string with unique profile url.
When user have fill slug he don't have ability to sign in.
After sign in, devise redirecting to root_path without authentication.
Or maybe I use something from bad patterns?
Thank you.
(FN) You should not be overriding to_key.
(TP) You should be overriding to_param in order to change the url.

title: use the decimal HTML escape code for single quotes instead of the hex on...
body: ...e so webkit-based browsers properly translate the code in form fields

(FN) Single quotes have been added to the HTML_ESCAPE hash in output_safety.rb, but they are currently being replaced with their hex code equivalent (& #x27;), which Chrome/Safari will display as-is in the form field.

(TP) If they are replaced with the decimal equiv (& #39;) instead, the browser will properly display a single quote in their place, as is already done with other escaped characters (& gt;, & amp;, etc.
(TP) @morgancurrie could you update the tests?
I'll merge
(TP) Good, this change is already in master.
Already applied.
Thanks
For clarification, this wasn't a webkit issue.
The issue was that escape_once was double-escaping the hex-encoded entity.
i.e.

It was
`<input type="text" value="Schrodinger&#x27;s Cat" />`
when it should have been
`<input type="text" value="Schrodinger's Cat" />`

Related #9088 #9101 #9102

title: Block Grid cuts CSS outlines on included elements
body:
(TPD) The new Bloc Grid from foundation 4 is very handy, but unlike the old foundation 3 grid, it cuts the [CSS outlines](http://www.w3schools.com/cssref/pr_outline.asp) of included elements (on top and only for the first row):

!

(TPD) [Plein_ cran_07_03_13_11_13](https://f.cloud.github.com/assets/1892819/231699/caa94bd4-870f-11e2-995e-eca95d0c7afb.png)

An easy workaround is to add a margin-top equal the the thickness of the outline on the elements contained in the grid but then the vertical space between two rows gets increased.

(TP) actually, a better workaround is to add an `overflow: visible;` to the ul element and to wrap it in a `<div class="row">` to prevent messing up the alignment of the elements following the block grid.
Excellent!
(TP) just to be sure, the fix is not included in the 4.0.7 version of the zurb-foundation gem?
(TP) because I just updated and still have the issue with this version.

title: Can't go from REDUCED_REDUNDANCY to STANDARD
body: (TPD) If I call bucket.copy_key and set storage_class to 'REDUCED_REDUNDANCY', and then call it again and set storage_class to 'STANDARD', I get this error: File "/usr/lib/python2.5/site-packages/boto-2.0b4-py2.5.egg/boto/s3/bucket.py", line 536, in copy_key raise provider.storage_response_error(response.status, response.reason, body) boto.exception.S3ResponseError: S3ResponseError: 400 Bad Request InvalidRequest This copy request is illegal because it is trying to copy an object to itself without changing the object's metadata, storage class or encryption attributes. 16FD346C0D311324 n6uxB/T47fGrFPeNHnYO1tvQFzyTOlIcmWgdaZI9uXytDOQnzXt/+zu+ieY/v/d3 This patch makes it work like I expect: $ diff boto/s3/bucket.py-orig boto/s3/bucket.py 562,563c562 < if storage_class != 'STANDARD': < headers[provider.storage_class_header] = storage_class --- > headers[provider.storage_class_header] = storage_class

title: ZipkinSpec doesn't tear down zookeeper instance
body: When running tests for zipkin server, the `ZipkinSpec` doesn't close the ZK instance that's started.

To reproduce:
```
  $ bin/sbt
  > test // this may pass
  > ...
  > test // ZipkinSpec will fail
```
(TP) Also we may want to consider using this to stand up the ZK instance: http://twitter.github.com/commons/apidocs/com/twitter/common/zookeeper/testing/ZookeeperTestServer.html
(TP) fixed in #23

title: Submenu is not opened when providing an own ActionView
body:
Release 3.5.0

Hi!
I ran into the following problem.
(FPD) All pre-3.0 devices show an icon for menu items not shown as action item since they are normal menu items.
But the color of the same menu item may differ when shown as action item.
(TPD) The appraoch until now was using a custom action view, set by a call to *setActionView*.
(TPD) This still works until the menu item is shown as action item is a submenu.
(TPD) Then the submenu is not shown since the action view is not of the expected runtime type.

(FND) See *com.actionbarsherlock.internal.view.menu.ActionMenuPresenter::findViewForItem* line 240:

```java
if (child instanceof MenuView.ItemView ...)
```
This is all no problem on 3.0+ devices.
These simply show no menu icon for non action bar items.
(TPD) So no custom action view is needed.
(FND) It would be very cool to have a compatibility interface to set an alternative icon if the menu item is shown in the action bar without supplying an own layout for the compatibility case.
I'm aware that this behavior does not apply to all platforms but the menu item icon display is also not common to all platforms.

Regards,
drsoran
Empty

title: NullPointerException in VersionedStore
body:
With Storm 0.7.2 and spout dequeing at about 100 messages / second, the server lasts for a minutes and then sporadically dies with: 

java.lang.NullPointerException
at backtype.storm.utils.VersionedStore.listDir(VersionedStore.java:161)
at backtype.storm.utils.VersionedStore.getAllVersions(VersionedStore.java:119)
at backtype.storm.utils.VersionedStore.createVersion(VersionedStore.java:67)
at backtype.storm.utils.VersionedStore.createVersion(VersionedStore.java:62)
at backtype.storm.utils.LocalState.persist(LocalState.java:45)
at backtype.storm.utils.LocalState.put(LocalState.java:34)
at backtype.storm.daemon.supervisor$syncprocesses.invoke(supervisor.clj:230)
at clojure.lang.AFn.applyToHelper(AFn.java:161)
at clojure.lang.AFn.applyTo(AFn.java:151)
at clojure.core$apply.invoke(core.clj:603)
at clojure.core$partial$fn4070.doInvoke(core.clj:2343)
at clojure.lang.RestFn.invoke(RestFn.java:397)
at backtype.storm.event$event_manager$fn_2173.invoke(event.clj:24)
at clojure.lang.AFn.run(AFn.java:24)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:722)
80033 [Thread-12] INFO  backtype.storm.util  - Halting process: ("Error when processing an event")

I am on Ubuntu 12.04, and running in local mode.
It's also worth noting that I am making a lot of outbound HTTP requests during this operation, and another server that was running on the same machine ran out of file descriptors.
(TPD) This could definitely be the same thing, but wouldn't it say "Too many open files" instead of just null pointer?
Running out of file descriptors can cause really weird issues.
Given that this error is filesystem related, I'd say it's very likely that's your cause.
Closing this issue for now, let me know if this reappears after you raise your file descriptor limit.

title: Compass is not installed as part of Zurb foundation gem installation
body: (FPD) I just installed the zurb-foundation gem via the instructions in http://foundation.zurb.com/docs/sass.html.

(FPD) In the 'creating your first project' section it seems to indicate (see below) that Compass is installed as part of the above gem installation

title: Add a new TwigExtension to enable to extends a template giving the key of a parameter wich is in the container
body:
(TPD) Add the capacity to set :

````
{% extends_by_config 'my_config.parameter_name' %}
````

Will be the same as :

````
{% extends 'DemoBundle::index.html.twig' %}
````
if the container parameter `my_config.parameter_name` value is `DemoBundle::index.html.twig`


----
Bug fix: no
Feature addition: yes
Backwards compatibility break: no
Symfony2 tests pass: no (i can't segmentation fault for symfony2 & phpunit)
fixes the following tickets: -
(TP) Wouldn't it make more sense to give direct access to the DI container's parameters?
(FN) The extends it's already a token managed by the Twig project and not by the TwigBundle.
(FN) So i don't know where we could add the capacity to parse a parameter from the container.
And how to determine if the path is a file path or a container parameter ?
(TP) I don't mean to add this functionality to 'extends', but to create a custom function for that, like 'get_param' in TwigBundle.
IMO, templates should not have access to the whole DI ParameterBag.
(TP) Most of them are used only to build services, others are meant to control some business logic.

(TP) the parameters really needed by the templates (when separating what is the responsibility of the template and what should be done by the controller) are only a few so they should be made available selectively in your app, either through global variables or through a Twig function.
(TP) Yes but when you use the tag `extends` it's for example because you want to share  a common layout.
(FN) Now if you've a public bundle, take `FOSUserBundle`.

(TP) If you want to overwrite only the base layout to use your own, you have to create another bundle with a `getParent()` and to copy all the template from the original bundle to your app only to change the `extends` token.
(TP) With this token you'll have only one config parameter to change in the config.yml so it make less code to write, less bundle to loads.
(TP) It's make the life easy and performance better.

(TP) instead of duplicating an entire bundle of views like that, I believe `./FOSUserBundle/Resources/views/layout.html.twig` could just be copied into `./app/Resources/FOSUserBundle/views/layout.html.twig` for customization or re-extending some other bundle's template - http://symfony.com/doc/current/book/templating.html#overriding-bundle-templates

Templates being dependent on DI seems unfortunate and I agree with @stof.
(FN) Another alternative could be to customize your application's default `Controller->render` method to add the necessary DI parameters into the template's parameters array.

title: starting first a non-data node and after that the data node will fail to allocate the index
body: (FPD) Thanks a lot for the great work!

(FPD) Not sure if the following is really a small bug or intentional:
For now (elasticsearch <=0.6) it is mandatory to start first a data-node and *after that* the non-data-node if you want to have access to the index (else => {  "error" : "IndexmissingException[[twitter] missing]" }.
-o
Can you explain more the process?
Not sure I followed.
(TP) for example, run this curl script, then start X, then stop, then restart, yada yada yada ;)
First, let me explain, I figured out what I was doing wrong - see at the bottom.

(FP) But first here is my scenario:

# start nodes to index something
$ bin/elasticsearch -Des.gateway.type=fs -Des.gateway.fs.location=/home/lucene/elasticsearch/snapshot/gateway -Des.index.gateway.snapshot_interval=-1 -Des.index.engine.robin.refresh_interval=-1 -Des.http.enabled=false

$ bin/elasticsearch -f -Des.node.data=false

$ curl -XPUT 'http://localhost:9200/twitter/tweet/1' -d '
{ 
    "user": "kimchy", 
    "postDate": "2009-11-15T13:12:00", 
    "message": "Trying out Elastic Search, so far so good?"

(FP) }'

$ curl -XGET 'http://localhost:9200/twitter/tweet/1?pretty=true'

{
  "_index" : "twitter",
  "_type" : "tweet",
  "_id" : "1", "_source" : 
{ 
    "user": "kimchy", 
    "postDate": "2009-11-15T13:12:00", 
    "message": "Trying out Elastic Search, so far so good?"

(FP) }
}
# shutdown all nodes and start first data node and after that the non data node
$ curl -XPOST 'http://localhost:9200/_cluster/nodes/_all/_shutdown'

$ bin/elasticsearch -Des.gateway.type=fs -Des.gateway.fs.location=/home/lucene/elasticsearch/snapshot/gateway -Des.index.gateway.snapshot_interval=-1 -Des.index.engine.robin.refresh_interval=-1 -Des.http.enabled=false

$ bin/elasticsearch -f -Des.node.data=false

$ curl -XGET 'http://localhost:9200/twitter/tweet/1?pretty=true'

{
  "_index" : "twitter",
  "_type" : "tweet",
  "_id" : "1", "_source" : 
{ 
    "user": "kimchy", 
    "postDate": "2009-11-15T13:12:00", 
    "message": "Trying out Elastic Search, so far so good?"

(FP) even when I now shutdown the non-data node and restart that non-data node,
these nodes donot "find" them (I guess) => cannot XGET a document.

(TP) But at least, I figured that when I start the non-data node with all the
parameters used for the data node, it works:

$  bin/elasticsearch -f -Des.node.data=false -Des.gateway.type=fs -Des.gateway.fs.location=/home/lucene/elasticsearch/snapshot/gateway -Des.index.gateway.snapshot_interval=-1 -Des.index.engine.robin.refresh_interval=-1
 
I was a little bit confused that it is necessary to parametrize a non-data node
with data-parameters,  but that will do it :)
Ahh, I see what happened... .
(TP) The problem is that the first node started will become the master and reload the cluster meta data (which includes indices created) from the gateway.
(TP) This is why you need to configure the gateway on it as well.
(TP) What you can do, by the way, is set `node.client` to `true` (will automatically set it to be a non data node as well).
(TP) In this case (this only works with the new zen discovery in upcoming 0.7), the client node will not become master, but wait till one will be started.
(FP) make sense?
excellent :)

title: transition-duration mixin doesn't support multiple arguments
body:
(FPD) From the documentation:

> One or more durations in seconds
> 
>   - for multiple, use a comma-delimited list
>   - these durations will affect the properties in the same list position

- - -

### foo, bar, baz

    +transition-duration(0.2s, 0.5s, 0.2s)

gives…

    error sass/screen.sass (Line {n}: Mixin transition-duration takes 1 argument but 3 were passed.)
(FPD) As a new Compass user, I expected `+transition-duration(0.2s, 0.5s, 0.2s)` to work.
(TP) seems like a bug.

(TP) workaround is an extra set of parenthesis:

    +transition-duration((0.2s, 0.5s, 0.2s))
Oh, yep.
(TP) I've been wrapping `0.2s, 0.5s, 0.2s` in quotes, which also works.
(TP) I don't think this is a bug since sass doesn't support literal arguments the same way ruby does so passing the extra set of parenthesis is needed for now.

title: unified null HTTPRequest body as ""
body: The way to handle null request.boy is different in httpclient.HTTPRequest and httpserver.HTTPRequest.
None or "" body will be convert to "" in httpserver.HTTPRequest, but not in httpclient.HTTPRequest.

(TPD) SimpleasyncHTTPClient().fetch(
                HTTPRequest(url=url,
                            method="GET",
                            body="",
                            headers=headers,
                            follow_redirects=False),
                callback)

title: AR scopes behave differently than class methods
body: *Imported from Lighthouse.

* Original ticket at: http://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/6512
created by **Szymon Nowak** - 2011-03-03 15:06:43 UTC

Rails 3.0.5:

``` ruby
class User < ActiveRecord::Base
  scope :a, where(:email => "a")
  scope :b, where(:email => "b")
  
  def self.c; where(:email => "c"); end
  def self.d; where(:email => "d"); end
end

# scope + scope
User.a.b.to_sql
# select "users".
* FROM "users" WHERE "users".

"email" = 'b' - only the last scope is present

# method + scope
User.c.b.to_sql
# select "users".
* FROM "users" WHERE "users".

"email" = 'b' - only the last scope is present

# scope + method
User.a.c.to_sql
# select "users".
* FROM "users" WHERE "users".
"email" = 'a' AND "users".

"email" = 'c'

# method + method
User.c.d.to_sql
# select "users".
* FROM "users" WHERE "users".
"email" = 'c' AND "users".

"email" = 'd'
```

Whenever there's a scope at the end of the chain, similar scopes before it are overwritten.
(TPD) When using class methods everything works fine.
*Imported from Lighthouse.

(TP) *
Comment by **Andrew White** - 2011-03-03 16:34:01 UTC

This is the intended behavior as looking for an email address equal to two different values will always give an empty result - [this][1] section of code is responsible for removing the duplicates.
(FN) The reason the class methods give the results that they do is they're merging the where values of AR:Relation which are already strings whereas the scope merges hashes.
[1]: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/activerecord/lib/active_record/relation/spawn_methods.rb#L34
*Imported from Lighthouse.

*
Comment by **Szymon Nowak** - 2011-03-03 16:42:07 UTC

Ok, the example with email was maybe not very fortunate, but in case of WHERE IN clause it really is not consisten:

``` ruby
class User < ActiveRecord::Base
  scope :a, where(:state => ["active", "confirmed"])
  scope :b, where(:state => ["deleted", "confirmed"])
end
```

If you try to use both scopes, it will return only the second one, but when you write it using where method explicitly, or using class methods, you'll get intersection of these 2 sets: WHERE IN ("active", "confirmed") AND WHERE IN ("deleted", "confirmed").
*Imported from Lighthouse.

*
Comment by **Andrew White** - 2011-03-03 17:31:17 UTC

Hmm, looking at this again it looks like another instance of this [bug][1].
What do you think Aaron?
Removing the code breaks a couple of tests which are specifically testing that the later key overrides the earlier key and it would make it consistent with relation merging.
[1]: https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994-ruby-on-rails/tickets/4598

title: Brew upgrade should order the upgrades by dependencies
body: When running `brew upgrade`, if a package and one of it's dependencies are both being upgraded, dependencies aren't considered when deciding on the install order.
The dependencies _are_ upgraded before upgrading the dependent package, but brew then attempts to upgrade them again, failing with a blank error.
See pcre and nginx in: https://gist.github.com/4ea130b9e999663c6039
(TP) Should be fixed---turned out the fix was simple but there was a bit of cleanup that had to be done in the core code.
Thanks for the report!

title: install_github and dependencies not on CRAN
body: I am the author of an R package names slidify which helps create HTML5 decks from R markdown.
(TPD) I want to separate development of the core R functions from the external dependencies which are essentially static assets (javascripts, stylesheets etc.)
(FND) Accordingly, I have split my package into two, both of which are on `github`.
My question is the following.
(FND) If I list the package containing the external dependencies as an `import`, will `install_github` automatically pick it up while installing the main package.
If not, what is best practice when dealing with such a situation.
The easiest way would be to have users install both packages from `github` directly.
(FPD) But, I was wondering if there was a more elegant solution.
(TP) We don't currently have a good solution, but it's something we're thinking about at RStudio.
(FN) Maybe a convention for defining a Dependences file with definitions for how to install packages?
Could be in R?
YAML?
What are you thinking at this point?
There shouldn't really be any technical challenge, right?
(FP) just figuring out a way that's simple without being too limited.
(TP) It isn't too technically challenging, but we need something that will also work for standalone projects, and we want to avoid making any data structure choices that restrict future innovation.
(FP) I though perhaps just assigning functions in a script where the function installs the package indicated by the name.
This could be loaded into an environment and then used to install any packages from the package dependencies.

```
devtools <- install_github("devtools")
roxygen3 <- install_github("roxygen3")
```
The main problem I see is that I'm not sure how you'd check versions so you're not just always installing everything.

title: Turn of retry-limit for AkkaProtocolStressTest #3466
body: (FPD) This test drops messages, but dropping too much will make it fail.
The reason is that this test expects at least a few of the final messages to arrive to prove that the Remoting does not get stuck in an irrecoverable state.
The retry limit enabled case is covered by the SystemMessageDelivery tests.
This is basically a revert to the original configuration.

title: Textconv support
body: (FND) Textconv is a way of transforming binary[1] data into something we can feed into our xdiff.
(FND) Typical use-cases for this are letting `exif` show us an image's metadata, or transforming a PDF or Word file into plain text.
(FND) Or even transforming an UTF-16/32 file into UTF-8.
(FND) We should allow the user to hook into our diffs in order to provide diff-able representations of data.
(TPD) Git does this via file extensions, which seems like a reasonable starting point.
We can then go crazy with the rules as useful ones crop up.
(FND) The registered functions would get a buffer with the contents and give us the textual representation of the data.

(FND) /cc @arrbee @brianmario 

[1] binary means that our xdiff can't show a sensible diff with it, regardless of what the data inside is meant to represent.
